subhead: After the murder of Mehdi Kessaci, the brother of an activist against drug trafficking, Le Monde spoke with residents of housing projects, social workers, judges and police officers. They described a growing sense of powerlessness and danger.

Trump warns Israel not to 'interfere' in Syria
subhead: Israeli forces killed 13 people on Friday in the southern village of Beit Jin and have defended their right to keep on striking. However, Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu and Donald Trump discussed 'expanding' regional peace deals when they spoke on Monday, the Israeli prime minister's office said in a statement.

title: Luigi Mangione, accused of killing a health insurance executive in New York in 2024, leaves Americans divided
subhead: The alleged killer of UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson, shot dead in broad daylight in Manhattan a year ago, appeared in court for a preliminary hearing on Monday, December 1. He faces life in prison.

title: Five artists to check out at the Trans Musicales festival in Rennes, France
subhead: Every Monday, Le Monde's Culture desk shares its top picks in music. Today: Five must-see concerts at the 47th edition of the renowned Breton festival, taking place from December 3 to 7.

title: Raphaël Varane: 'Showing vulnerability does not mean you're weak'
subhead: In an interview with Le Monde, the retired footballer shares his experiences with mental health issues during his career and calls on his sport to break the silence around these problems, which affect an estimated 20% to 35% of professional players.

Paris restaurants with a New York attitude
subhead: The French capital has recently seen a wave of New York-style restaurants spring up, from slice shops to delis and red sauce joints. Parisians are flocking to these spots to savor not only a slice of culinary culture but also the enduring myth of the Big Apple.

title: How Islamology stepped out of French academia's shadows after the 2015 jihadist attacks
subhead: Once a jewel of French research, Islamology began to decline in the 1980s, but the 2015 attacks forced authorities to refocus their efforts in this field of knowledge. Although the discipline has since experienced something of a revival, its recovery remains fragile, both as an academic subject and a highly political issue.

title: The art of being Oscar Wilde's grandson
subhead: As Ireland prepares to mark the 125th anniversary of Oscar Wilde's death, Merlin Holland, his only living descendant, works in France to protect the memory of a man who was long viewed as scandalous.
